intro: Strychnos adolfi-friderici, commonly known as the Adolph-Friedrich strychnos, is a shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and showy, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain seeds surrounded by a fleshy aril. While it is not widely cultivated, it is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles. However, caution is advised as some species in the genus contain toxic compounds.
